com.vaadin.fluent.api

Interface FluentHasValue<THIS,VALUE>

  • Type Parameters:
    THIS - Self-referential generic THIS
    VALUE - The value type
    All Superinterfaces:
    com.vaadin.data.HasValue<VALUE>, Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FluentAbstractDateField<THIS,FIELD,R>, FluentAbstractField<THIS,FIELD>, FluentAbstractLocalDateField<THIS>, FluentAbstractLocalDateTimeField<THIS>, FluentAbstractMultiSelect<THIS,VALUE>, FluentAbstractSingleSelect<THIS,VALUE>, FluentAbstractTextField<THIS>, FluentCheckBox<THIS>, FluentCheckBoxGroup<THIS,VALUE>, FluentComboBox<THIS,ITEM>, FluentCustomField<THIS,T>, FluentDateField<THIS>, FluentDateTimeField<THIS>, FluentInlineDateField<THIS>, FluentListSelect<THIS,ITEM>, FluentMultiSelect<THIS,VALUE>, FluentNativeSelect<THIS,ITEM>, FluentRadioButtonGroup<THIS,ITEM>, FluentRichTextArea<THIS>, FluentSlider<THIS>, FluentTextArea<THIS>, FluentTextField<THIS>, FluentTwinColSelect<THIS,ITEM>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FCheckBox, FCheckBoxGroup, FComboBox, FDateField, FDateTimeField, FInlineDateField, FListSelect, FNativeSelect, FRadioButtonGroup, FRichTextArea, FSlider, FTextArea, FTextField, FTwinColSelect

    public interface FluentHasValue<THIS,VALUE>
extends com.vaadin.data.HasValue<VALUE>
    The base interface for fluent versions of HasValue
    See Also:
    HasValue

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.vaadin.data.HasValue

        com.vaadin.data.HasValue.ValueChangeEvent<V>, com.vaadin.data.HasValue.ValueChangeListener<V>

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface com.vaadin.data.HasValue

        addValueChangeListener, clear, getDefaultValidator, getEmptyValue, getOptionalValue, getValue, isEmpty, isReadOnly, isRequiredIndicatorVisible, setReadOnly, setRequiredIndicatorVisible, setValue

    • Method Detail

      • withValue

        default THIS withValue(VALUE value)
        Sets the value of this object. If the new value is not equal to getValue(), fires a value change event. May throw IllegalArgumentException if the value is not acceptable.

        Implementation note: the implementing class should document whether null values are accepted or not.

        Parameters:
        value - the new value
        Returns:
        this (for method chaining)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the value is invalid
        See Also:
        HasValue.setValue(Object)

      • withReadOnly

        default THIS withReadOnly(boolean readOnly)
        Sets the read-only mode of this HasValue to given mode. The user can't change the value when in read-only mode.

        A HasValue with a visual component in read-only mode typically looks visually different to signal to the user that the value cannot be edited.

        Parameters:
        readOnly - a boolean value specifying whether the component is put read-only mode or not
        Returns:
        this (for method chaining)
        See Also:
        HasValue.setReadOnly(boolean)

      • withRequiredIndicatorVisible

        default THIS withRequiredIndicatorVisible(boolean requiredIndicatorVisible)
        Sets the required indicator visible or not.

        If set visible, it is visually indicated in the user interface.

        Parameters:
        requiredIndicatorVisible - true to make the required indicator visible, false if not
        Returns:
        this (for method chaining)
        See Also:
        HasValue.setRequiredIndicatorVisible(boolean)

      • withValueChangeListener

        default THIS withValueChangeListener(com.vaadin.data.HasValue.ValueChangeListener<VALUE> listener)
        Adds a value change listener. The listener is called when the value of this HasValue is changed either by the user or programmatically.
        Parameters:
        listener - the value change listener, not null
        Returns:
        this (for method chaining)
        See Also:
        HasValue.addValueChangeListener(com.vaadin.data.HasValue.ValueChangeListener)
